title: Mum, 23, beat toddler son to death because he soiled his nappies
text:

A mum has been charged with killing her toddler son after she viciously beat him up for soiling his nappies, according to an arrest warrant.

Trinity Pittman was arrested on Saturday on suspicion of murder and first-degree child cruelty.

The 23-year-old took her son Conner Perry to hospital on Friday and claimed he had fallen off a trampoline.

However, medical staff at Piedmont Newnan Hospital in Georgia became suspicious because the child’s injuries were inconsistent with that story.

(Image: Facebook)

Conner's abdominal cavity was filled with blood and his lungs were filling up with fluids when he was admitted to hospital, according to warrants obtained by the channel 11 Alive .

The toddler also suffered a broken jaw, cuts and bruises to his face, had several teeth missing teeth and had bleeding on his brain.

Late on Friday evening he was transferred to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta, where he died of his injuries at 11pm.

The warrants state that Pittman later confessed to hitting the child several times in anger over the dirty diaper.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

At one point during the attack, Conner fell and hit his head on the floor, then 'went to sleep,' according the boy's mother.

The warrant states that Pittman headed off to work hours after the beating, leaving Conner and his four-year-old brother in the care of her boyfriend, 24-year-old Jeremy Davis.

Pittman allegedly lied to Davis about Conner's trampoline fall as well.

The boyfriend later called Pittman, telling her that Conner woke up vomiting and having trouble breathing.

(Image: Facebook)

An autopsy report revealed that Conner Perry's body also showed signs of old injuries, reported Fox 5 Atlanta.

Pittman made her initial court appearance on Sunday and was denied bond.

Pittman's surviving child is currently staying with relatives.
description: Trinity Pittman has been charged with murder and child cruelty after her 20-month-old son Conner Perry died in Georgia, USA
